ait.base module

This module defines the basic data structurs of the finite state machine

class ait.base.Event(name: str)[source]

Bases: ABC

Event interface

abstract fire(source: State, args: dict) → tuple[State, dict][source]

Fire the event on source state with arguments

Parameters:

  • source (State) – source state the event acts on

  • args (dict) – arguments used to form a event or custmize the environment

Returns:

target state and the result of the event processing. if the API returns error, the state must be an invalid state

Return type:

tuple[State, dict]

property name: str

name of the event

Returns:

the name of the event

Return type:

str

class ait.base.State[source]

Bases: ABC

Interface of State

A state is a deterministic situation of running system which is represented in a unique collection of properties.

This interface defines properties and methods a State class should provide.

abstract fetch_state(**kwargs)[source]

abstract method of fetching current state

property is_valid: bool

The state is valid or not. If the target state in a transient is invalid means the API returns error on source state.

Returns:

the state is valid or not

Return type:

bool

property label: str

Returns:

the detail of the state

Return type:

str

property name: str

State name used in the graph

Returns:

the name of the state

Return type:

str

property value: dict

The value of the state

Returns:

a dictionary represents the state

Return type:
